title: Ping trouble
body: My ping was alaways a solid 65 occasionally bouncing up to round 90 now since 6.20 my ping has bounced around 100-250 and dcing 2-4 times a game. Riot help pls

replies.body:
It sounds like there may be some issues somewhere along your network routing to the server. Before we take a look into that, I'd like you to first confirm your network settings locally are compatible with League by working through our [connection guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

Let me know if those steps caused any sort of change.
I haven't changed anything on my computer within this time window and all my settings are correct, but if its not on your end then i should call my service provider?
You'll need data to provide your ISP if you'd like them to investigate. Before we grab that data, can you confirm you've worked through all the steps in the guide I linked above?
Ive worked through all the steps

Thanks for confirming! To get an idea of what's happening between your PC and our servers, we can take a look at a traceroute log. You can run this by first grabbing a network app called [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/). You'll then want to plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field before starting your trace. After it has run for about 5 minutes, export the data as text and paste them in a reply to me.

Let me know if you encounter issues running this.
i downloaded winmtr it just appears in a compressed zip folder i dont know what to do now
Launch the application from the folder, then input the IP address I listed above, start the trace, let it run, then export the results and paste them in a reply.

It looks like the poor latency starts inside your network, and could be caused by a malfunctioning modem or router. I'd recommend giving your entire network a reboot by pulling the power plugs from your router/modem for 60 seconds, then plug it back in, then restart your computers. If you notice high latency again in-game after the network reboot, run another trace and paste the new results here again.

It definitely looks like your latency spikes to 974ms on the first hop outside of your home network at the following node: 

> **rd2bb-tge0-4-0-4-1.no.shawcable.net**

Your hop continues along the way to the server with high latency along the entire route. I'd recommend reaching out to a tier 2 agent at your ISP with this traceroute so they can launch an investigation.

Let me know if you have any questions.
sorry i took so long to reply i after i tried this it seems to be working but i tried imputing the same ip but im getting no response from hose
